quizInfo.Subject: Advanced Systems Integration and Architecture
quizInfo.Title: Review of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems

quizData.question: What is a business software that collects information from different departments to enable leaders to monitor the company with detailed analytics and reporting?
What unifies crucial functions such as finance, manufacturing, inventory and order management, sales and marketing, project management, and human resources?
Which is NOT needed to understand when choosing an ERP?
What is the market leader for enterprise application software?
What is a German multinational company that pioneered software?
In what year was SAP founded for the development of real-time data application software?
What is he standard ERP solution for companies worldwide?
What enables a company to support and optimize its business processes and allows the collection of logically related transactions?
What is the result of SAP's strategic goal to develop a next-generation ERP package?
What is the next-generation Business Suite and the biggest innovation since SAP R/3?
SAP S/4HANA is designed to strengthen companies of every size in various industries, while SAP ERP caters more to large, enterprise-level organizations.
What is a design system and a user experience (UX) layer that allows business app creation with a consumer-grade user experience?
What provides a user interface for SAP S/4HANA?
What makes casual users into SAP experts with simple screens that run on any device?
Which is NOT an application type of SAP Fiori?
What are used to access tasks like Create, Change, or Display Process with guided navigation?
What application type gives a visual overview of business data?
What application type with a view of the essential information about objects and contextual navigation between related objects?
Which is NOT a data type than can be used and found in SAP S/4HANA?
What data type is a part of the organizational unit, such as the company code, plant, storage location, and distribution channel?
What data type represents logically grouped data like customer master, material master, vendor master, and general ledger accounts?
What data type is a system record of the business event wherein different master data and organization data will be referenced?
What is the business transaction record called, which includes predefined information from the master data and organizational entities?
Who is responsible for Idea-to-Market and Build-to-Stock in Global Bike?
Who is responsible for Order-to-Cash and Service & Support in Global Bike?

Which strategy is used in the statement?
Having an extensive innovation network to source ideas from riders, dealers, and professionals to improve its bicycles' performance, reliability, and quality.

Which strategy is used in the statement?
Global Bike outsources the production of off-road and touring frames and carbon composite wheels to trusted partners with specialty facilities to create the complex materials used. They maintain collaborative research and design relationships with these facilities to ensure that innovations in both material and structural capabilities are included in the frames

Which strategy is used in the statement?
Global Bike sells its bikes exclusively through reputable and respected Independent Bicycle Dealers (IBDs). These dealers have staff members with expertise in offroad and tour racing to help consumers pick the right Global Bike bike and accessories for their individual needs.

Which strategy is used in the statement?
All ERP functions are centralized to reduce costs and deliver global best-in-class technology to all divisions.
Which allows allows organizations to store and manage customer- and product-related data?
Which is the smallest organizational unit where a legal set of books can be maintained?
Which of the following is not part of SD Organizational Units?
Which of the following contains all the information a company needs to manage a material?
Which of the following includes prices, surcharges (additional charge), discounts, freights (goods transferred from place to place), and taxes?
Which of the following contains all the necessary information for business activities with an external supplier?
Which of the following is the first step in Processes (Sales Order)?
Which of the following is not part of MM Organizational Units?
Which of the following allows buyers to quickly determine which vendors have offered or supplied specific materials?
Which of the following is the first step in Processes (Procure-to-Pay)?
Which of the following is concerned with helping organizations with material and inventory management and warehouse management in the supply chain process?
Which of the following aligns demand with manufacturing capacity in creating production and procurement schedules for the finished products and component materials?
Which of the following tracks and records the manufacturing process flow such as the planned and actual costs and good movement from the conversion of raw material to semi-finished goods?
Which of the following is the organizational unit of Production Planning and Execution?
It lists the components of a product or assembly.
It is the series of sequential steps/operations that must be carried out to produce a product.
It is the location within a plant where value-added work (operations or activities) is performed.
It is the aggregate planning that groups materials or other product groups.
Which of the following is designed to collect transactional data for preparing the standard portfolio of reports?
Which of the following is a classification scheme consisting of a group of general ledger (G/L) accounts used by one or more company codes?
Which of the following represents a separate area of operations or responsibilities within an organization and to which value changes recorded in Financial Accounting can be allocated?
Which of the following is the data storage area created by the unique combination of Company Code and Chart of Account?
Which of the following is the summary of an organization’s assets, liabilities, and equity at a point in time?
Which of the following shows an organization’s revenues and expenses at a point in time?
Which of the following is considered the associated changes in cash, which can be viewed as the most important of all assets?
